intro: Seriphidium namanganicum, commonly known as the Namangan wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, composite flower heads that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
